issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires initializing the Farm's internal ArrayList in a constructor with no arguments (a no-arg constructor). The solution, however, provides only a constructor with an int parameter (public Farm(int initialCapacity)), and thus no explicit no-arg constructor exists. This is a constructor-parameter mismatch: students following the problem text or the template Main (which uses new Farm()) would expect a no-arg Farm() constructor, but the solution's Farm API does not provide it. This mismatch can cause compilation confusion or prevent straightforward use of the provided example Main code.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a public no-argument constructor to Farm in the solution that initializes the animals list (e.g. public Farm() { this.animals = new ArrayList<>(); }). Optionally keep the existing Farm(int) overload if desired. Also ensure example Main code uses the constructor form provided (either update Main to use the int-arg constructor or provide the no-arg constructor to match Main and the problem statement).
